recount3 0.99.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • recount3 quick start guide
  • Changelog

Read a metadata file

Source: R/read_metadata.R
read_metadata.Rd

This function reads in a recount3 metadata file into R. You can first locate the file using file_locate_url() then download it to your computer using file_retrieve().

read_metadata(metadata_file)

Arguments

metadata_file

A character(1) with the local path to a recount3 metadata file.

Value

A data.frame() with all lower case column names for the sample metadata.

See also

Other internal functions for accessing the recount3 data: annotation_ext(), create_rse_manual(), file_locate_url_annotation(), file_locate_url(), file_retrieve(), project_home_available(), read_counts()

Examples


## Download the metadata file for project ERP110066
url_ERP110066_meta <- file_locate_url("ERP110066", "data_sources/sra")
local_ERP110066_meta <- file_retrieve(url = url_ERP110066_meta)
#> Caching file sra.metadata.ERP110066.MD.gz

## Read the metadata
ERP110066_meta <- read_metadata(local_ERP110066_meta)
head(ERP110066_meta)

#> 1 Single-cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) on nocodazole and DMSO treated cells before and after differentiation into endoderm. hPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours and induced to differentiate into definitive endoderm for three days. Single cells were subsequently collected in either undifferentiated conditions (Und) or after 3 days of endoderm differentiation (Endoderm) and then sorted onto 384 well plates for Smart-Seq2 processing.

#> 6         paired                   400                    0
#>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     library_construction_protocol
#> 1 Cells  were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. Conversion was performed following the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) using a poly-Dt30 oligo and a TSO oligo. RNA extraction is based on the Picelli et al SS2 protocol, using a polydT primer plus the template switching oligo – TSO, as published (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Single hPSCs were isolated into 384 wells plates and libraries were prepared for 120 cells/per condition using the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) and using Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit – Illumina. A constant amount of spike-in RNA from the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) was also added to the lysis buffer prior to sorting.
#> 2 Cells  were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). Cell sorting and library preparation was carried out by the sequencing core facility at the Wellcome Sanger Institute. Single hPSCs were isolated into 384 wells plates and libraries were prepared for 120 cells/per condition using the SMART-Seq2 protocol (https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2014.006) and using Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation Kit - Illumina. A constant amount of spike-in RNA from the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) was also added to the lysis buffer prior to sorting.|developmental stage;;adult|disease;;normal|ENA checklist;;ERC000011|genotype;;wild type genotype|growth condition;;normal culture to maintain pluripotency|INSDC center alias;;Wellcome Sanger Institute|INSDC center name;;Wellcome Sanger Institute|INSDC first public;;2019-06-16T17:03:41Z|INSDC last update;;2018-07-25T16:48:03Z|INSDC status;;public|organism part;;blood|organism;;Homo sapiens|progenitor cell type;;blood cell|Sample Name;;ERS2624038|sex;;male|SRA accession;;ERS2624038|stimulus;;synchronization|Title;;0hS_22728_4_106
#> 4 Alias;;E-MTAB-7008:0hS_22728_4_107|Broker name;;ArrayExpress|cell_line;;HPSI0813i-fpdm_2|cell_type;;induced pluripotent stem cell|Description;;Protocols: Cells were treated with Accutase and, once obtained single cells, were filtered (40um strainers), counted and resuspended in PBS/BSA (at 1%) at 10^6/mL to sort them into 384-well plates (containing the lysis buffer and ERCCs). The hiPSC line FSPS13B was plated on vitronectin coated plates (10µg/ml, Stem Cell Technologies) and cultured in E6 media supplemented with 2ng/ml TGF-β (R&D) and 25ng/ml FGF2 making complete E8 media. Cells were maintained by weekly passaging using 0.5mM EDTA (Thermo Fisher Scientific). hiPSC colonies were treated with DMSO or 100ng/ml nocodazole for 16 hours. Following synchronisation, cells were maintained in pluripotency conditions or induced to form definitive endoderm using a 3-day protocol. On day 1 cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4, 100ng/ml Activin A and 3µM CHIR99021. On day 2 the cells were cultured in CDM-PVA supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2, 10µM LY294002, 10ng/ml BMP4 and 100ng/ml Activin A. On day 3 the cells were cultured in RPMI-B27 media supplemented with 80ng/ml FGF2 and 100ng/ml Activin. ## Locate and read the GTEx bladder metadata
gtex_bladder_meta <- read_metadata(
    file_retrieve(
        file_locate_url("BLADDER", "data_sources/gtex")
    )
)
